title: Notarial Practice Course 2016 entry - Open Day
desc: UCL Faculty of Laws Open Day ?UCL Notarial Practice Course? 2016-18 ? This Open Day gives prospective students the opportunity to find out about the role and function of Public Notaries, including how they are trained, how they practice and how they are regulated. Student will have the opportunity to meet formally and informally with the UCL course tutors as well as representatives of the regulatory body, The Faculty Office, and the Notary Society. ? Speaker:? Stephen Borton, Chief Clerk of the Faculty Office of the Archbishop of Canterbury Speakers:? Dr Ian Williams (UCL Course Convenor (Year 1) - Roman Law)? Dr Alex Mills (UCL Course  Convenor ?(Year 1) - Private International Law) Iain Rogers (UCL Course  Convenor ?(Year 2) - Notarial Practice) Post Notarial Practice Course Speaker: ? Stephen Borton, Chief Clerk of the Faculty Office of the Archbishop of Canterbury Tea and informal questions session
